title: My Development Setup: Tools and Workflow for 2025
author: Niaz Bin Siraj
contents:
A good development setup can significantly boost your productivity and make coding more enjoyable. Here's my current development setup and the tools that help me write better code faster.

💻 Hardware

Main Machine

  • Laptop: MacBook Pro 16" M2 Pro (32GB RAM, 1TB SSD)
  • Monitor: 27" 4K Dell UltraSharp U2720Q
  • Keyboard: Keychron K8 (Mechanical, Hot-swappable)
  • Mouse: Logitech MX Master 3S
  • Headphones: Sony WH-1000XM4 (for those deep coding sessions)

Desk Setup

  • Standing Desk: UPLIFT V2 (height adjustable)
  • Monitor Arm: Herman Miller Ollin
  • Lighting: BenQ ScreenBar Halo (reduces eye strain)
  • Chair: Herman Miller Aeron (worth the investment!)

⚙️ Software & Tools

Code Editor: Visual Studio Code

VS Code is my go-to editor with these essential extensions:

// Essential Extensions
- Prettier (Code formatter)
- ESLint (JavaScript linting)
- Auto Rename Tag
- Live Server
- GitLens
- Thunder Client (API testing)
- Bracket Pair Colorizer
- Material Icon Theme
- One Dark Pro (Theme)

Terminal: iTerm2 + Oh My Zsh

My terminal setup for maximum productivity:

# Oh My Zsh plugins
plugins=(
  git
  zsh-autosuggestions
  zsh-syntax-highlighting
  web-search
  jsontools
  node
  npm
)

# Useful aliases
alias ll="ls -la"
alias gs="git status"
alias gp="git push"
alias gc="git commit"
alias code="code ."

Version Control: Git + GitHub

Git configuration for better commits:

# Global Git config
git config --global user.name "Niaz Bin Siraj"
git config --global user.email "niaz@example.com"
git config --global init.defaultBranch main
git config --global pull.rebase false

# Better commit messages with gitmoji
npm install -g gitmoji-cli

🛠 Development Tools

Package Managers & Runtime

  • Node.js: Latest LTS version via nvm
  • npm/yarn: For package management
  • Homebrew: macOS package manager

Database Tools

  • TablePlus: Database management GUI
  • MongoDB Compass: MongoDB GUI
  • Redis Insight: Redis GUI

API Development

  • Postman: API testing and documentation
  • Insomnia: Alternative REST client
  • Thunder Client: VS Code extension for API testing

Design & Prototyping

  • Figma: UI/UX design and prototyping
  • Sketch: Vector graphics (occasionally)
  • ImageOptim: Image compression

🌐 Browser Setup

Chrome Extensions for Development

  • React Developer Tools
  • Vue.js devtools
  • Redux DevTools
  • Lighthouse (built-in)
  • ColorZilla (color picker)
  • JSON Viewer
  • Wappalyzer (technology detection)

📱 Productivity Apps

Note Taking & Documentation

  • Notion: All-in-one workspace for notes, projects, and planning
  • Obsidian: Knowledge management with linking
  • Markdown editors: Typora, Mark Text

Task Management

  • Todoist: Personal task management
  • Linear: Project management for teams
  • Trello: Kanban boards for simple projects

Communication

  • Slack: Team communication
  • Discord: Community discussions
  • Zoom/Meet: Video calls

⚡ Workflow & Productivity Tips

Daily Routine

  1. Morning Review: Check GitHub notifications, plan the day
  2. Deep Work Blocks: 2-3 hour focused coding sessions
  3. Regular Breaks: 15-minute break every hour
  4. End-of-day Review: Commit code, update tasks

Code Organization

// Project structure I follow
project/
├── src/
│   ├── components/
│   ├── hooks/
│   ├── utils/
│   ├── services/
│   └── styles/
├── tests/
├── docs/
├── .github/
└── README.md

Backup & Sync

  • iCloud: Document and settings sync
  • GitHub: Code repositories
  • Time Machine: Local backups
  • Dropbox: File sharing and collaboration

🎨 Themes & Customization

VS Code Theme

// settings.json highlights
{
  "workbench.colorTheme": "One Dark Pro",
  "editor.fontFamily": "Fira Code, Menlo, Monaco, monospace",
  "editor.fontLigatures": true,
  "editor.fontSize": 14,
  "editor.lineHeight": 1.6,
  "editor.tabSize": 2,
  "editor.wordWrap": "on",
  "editor.minimap.enabled": false,
  "workbench.startupEditor": "none"
}

Terminal Theme

  • Color Scheme: Dracula or One Dark
  • Font: Fira Code with ligatures
  • Prompt: Starship prompt for Git info

📚 Learning & Staying Updated

Resources I Follow

  • Newsletters: JavaScript Weekly, CSS-Tricks, DEV Digest
  • Podcasts: Syntax.fm, The Changelog, JS Party
  • YouTube: Fireship, Traversy Media, The Net Ninja
  • Books: You Don't Know JS, Clean Code, Design Patterns

Practice Platforms

  • LeetCode: Algorithm practice
  • CodeSandbox: Quick prototyping
  • GitHub: Open source contributions
  • Personal Projects: Always building something new!

💰 Cost Breakdown

Here's what this setup costs (approximate):

  • Hardware: $4,000 - $6,000 (one-time investment)
  • Software: $50 - $100/month (subscriptions)
  • Learning: $30 - $50/month (courses, books)

Final Thoughts

This setup has evolved over years of trial and error. The key is to:

  • Start simple and gradually add tools as needed
  • Invest in good hardware – it pays off in productivity
  • Automate repetitive tasks with scripts and tools
  • Keep learning and adapting your workflow

"The best setup is the one that gets out of your way and lets you focus on creating amazing things."

What tools are essential in your development setup? I'd love to hear about your workflow and favorite productivity tools!

Happy coding! 🚀
